alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 7:48AM CDT until May 19 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Wharton, Austin, Colorado and Fort Bend Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.2 feet on 11/06/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 20.4 Tue 7 am CDT 19.7 17.7 16.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
